definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: For anyone involved I'm sure the first call was mortifying.
sentences.chinese: 对任何人来说第一个电话必然是令人气恼。

sentences.english: Nothing is more irritating than being stood up.
sentences.chinese: 没有一件事比苦等爽约的人更令人气恼的了。

sentences.english: The iniquities of the unions are her pet peeve at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 此时协会中的歪风邪气是令她最气恼的事。

sentences.english: Verily, he is not indignant at their modes of consolation and ingratitude.
sentences.chinese: 其实，他并不气恼他们自我安慰和忘恩负义的模式。

sentences.english: He is good-humored and never took offence.
I think the fact that he's working with amateurs really frustrates him.
sentences.chinese: 我看和一些外行在一起工作让他很是气恼。

sentences.english: I wanna know if it was repressed black anger or just giddiness .
sentences.chinese: 我想知道，是被压抑的气恼，还是轻佻。

sentences.english: I got annoyed when Isaw him late again last class.
sentences.chinese: 当我上节课瞅见他又来晚时，我变患上很气恼。

sentences.english: The late dinner disgruntled my father.
sentences.chinese: 晚饭太晚让我父亲气恼了。

sentences.english: Messy classrooms are Dr. J's pet peeves.
sentences.chinese: 脏乱的教室是J博士最气恼的事。

definition: variant of 憤憤|愤愤[fen4 fen4]
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
